intro: Muehlenbeckia, commonly known as silverweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America, although some are found in Australia and New Zealand. The plants are typically herbaceous, often growing as shrubs or creeping plants with slender stems. Their leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Muehlenbeckia species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
